# 217th Division (People's Republic of China)

The 217th Division () was created in November 1949 under the Regulation of the Redesignations of All Organizations and Units of the Army, issued by the Central Military Commission on November 1, 1948, based on the 4th and 5th Division, 2nd Corps, 1st Army Group of the People's Liberation Army of the Nationalist Party of China. Its history can be traced to the 63rd Division, 14th Corps, 1st Army Group of the Republic of China Army defected in August 1948.
The division is part of the 53rd Corps. Under the flag of the 217th division it took part in the Chinese Civil War.
In March 1952 the division was reorganized as the 3rd Water Conservancy Construction Division().
In July 1953 the division was further reorganized as the 1st Road Engineering Division().
In 1955 the division was demobilized.
